subject: Earth & Climate System Mathematics
title: Mathematics of Climate and Earth System Sciences (TUM, Module ED110088)
description: Mathematical analysis and modeling of nonlinear processes in the climate and Earth system: nonlinear/chaotic dynamics, analytical and numerical methods, time-series analysis, stochastic and non-autonomous systems, and tipping-point phenomena. Workload 270 h (90 h contact), 9 ECTS, offered in winter term. Version 2023s responsible: Boers, Niklas.

goals.title: Math of Climate & Earth System – Module Overview
goals.description: Learner masters mathematical tools for nonlinear climate/Earth-system processes, including dynamical systems, stochastic modeling, time-series methods, and tipping-point analysis.
goals.titleEn: Math of Climate & Earth System – Module Overview
goals.descriptionEn: Learner masters mathematical tools for nonlinear climate/Earth-system processes, including dynamical systems, stochastic modeling, time-series methods, and tipping-point analysis.

goals.title: Nonlinear & Chaotic Dynamics
goals.description: Learner can analyze nonlinear and chaotic dynamical systems relevant to the climate/Earth system using analytical and numerical tools.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can analyze nonlinear and chaotic dynamical systems relevant to the climate/Earth system using analytical and numerical tools.

goals.title: Fluid Mechanics & PDE Methods
goals.description: Learner can derive and analyze core fluid-mechanics equations and apply analytical/numerical techniques to Earth-system problems.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can derive and analyze core fluid-mechanics equations and apply analytical/numerical techniques to Earth-system problems.

goals.title: Time-Series Analysis for Earth Systems
goals.description: Learner can rigorously analyze time series from climate/Earth-system processes, with a focus on nonlinear dynamics.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can rigorously analyze time series from climate/Earth-system processes, with a focus on nonlinear dynamics.

goals.title: Stochastic & Non-Autonomous Systems
goals.description: Learner can explain stochastic and non-autonomous dynamical systems and apply stochastic differential-equation concepts to Earth-system modeling.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can explain stochastic and non-autonomous dynamical systems and apply stochastic differential-equation concepts to Earth-system modeling.

goals.title: Tipping Points & Critical Transitions
goals.description: Learner can identify and assess critical transitions and tipping points in Earth-system models, linking theory to observed or simulated time series.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can identify and assess critical transitions and tipping points in Earth-system models, linking theory to observed or simulated time series.

titleEn: Mathematics of Climate and Earth System Sciences (TUM, Module ED110088)
descriptionEn: Mathematical analysis and modeling of nonlinear processes in the climate and Earth system: nonlinear/chaotic dynamics, analytical and numerical methods, time-series analysis, stochastic and non-autonomous systems, and tipping-point phenomena. Workload 270 h (90 h contact), 9 ECTS, offered in winter term. Version 2023s responsible: Boers, Niklas.
